tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"This is a song that David wrote"

tn.ref: concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite
tn.text: The phrase "words of Cush" represents what he said. AT: "about what Cush, a man from the tribe of Benjamin, said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Going to Yahweh for protection is spoken of as taking refuge in him. AT: "go to you for protection!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: they will rip me apart like a lion, tearing me in pieces
tn.text: David speaks of his enemies attacking him as if they would rip his body apart and tear it in pieces as a lion would. AT: "they will violently kill me like a lion ripping apart its victim's body and tearing it in pieces" or "they will violently kill me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: with no one else able to bring me to safety
tn.text: "and no one else will be able to save me"

tn.ref: there is no injustice on my hands
tn.text: The hands represent what a person does. Having injustice on them represents having done something that is not just. AT: "there is no injustice in what I have done" or "I have not done anything unjust to anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The life represents the person. AT: "me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"catch up to it" or "reach it." This represents capturing him. AT: "capture me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: let him trample my living body on the ground
tn.text: Here "my living body" represents the writer. AT: "allow my enemies to destroy me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This means lying dead and unburied in disgrace.
Arising represents doing something or taking action. AT: "Do something in your anger" or "Be angry at my enemies and take action: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: stand up against the rage of my enemies
tn.text: Fighting against people is spoken of as standing up against them. AT: "fight against the rage of my enemies" or "attack my enemies who rage against me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Their rage represents their attacks. AT: "the attacks of my enemies" or "my enemies who attack me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Waking up represents starting to do something or take action. AT: "Take action" or "Do something" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"for me" or "to help me"
Here the word "countries" represents all of the armies that have gathered to attack. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: take once more your rightful place over them
tn.text: Ruling people is spoken of as being over them. Yahweh's rightful place refers either to heaven or to ruling in general. AT: "Rule over them from heaven" or "Rule over them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"show them that I am not guilty"
"make the righteous people strong" or "make the righteous people prosper"

tn.ref: you who examine hearts and minds
tn.text: The hearts and minds represent people's desires and thoughts. AT: "you who know our inner thoughts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "shield" represents God's protection. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: a God who is indignant each day
tn.text: Who God is angry with can be stated explicitly. AT: "a God who is angry with the wicked every day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: God will sharpen his sword and will prepare his bow for battle
tn.text: In verses 12 and 13, David speaks of God deciding to punish the wicked as if God were a warrior preparing to fight against them with weapons.  AT: "God will take action against him like a warrior who sharpens his sword and prepares his bow for battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: one who is pregnant with wickedness ... conceives destructive plans ... gives birth to harmful lies
tn.text: David speaks of the things that a wicked person does as if the person were pregnant and wickedness was the baby. AT:  "the wicked person. He makes plans to destroy people and produces harmful lies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: His own destructive plans return to his own head, for his violence comes down on his own head
tn.text: Destruction and violence are spoken of as if they hit a person's head or fall down on it. AT: "His own destructive plans destroy him, for his violence attacks him" or "When he plans to destroy others, others destroy him; when he attacks others, others attack him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
